content.question:
Female European corn borer moths (Ostrinia nubilalis) produce the sex pheromone <math alttext="11" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>11</mn><mo>−</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>tetradecenyl acetate (<math alttext="11 T D A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>11</mn><mo>−</mo><mtext>TDA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>), which attracts males of their species. <math alttext="11 T D A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>11</mn><mo>−</mo><mtext>TDA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> can be produced in two forms, <math alttext="E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>E</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Z</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, each with a different three-dimensional shape. Researchers have discovered two different strains of the European corn borer moth living in the same area. Females of the <math alttext="E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>E</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> strain produce primarily the <math alttext="E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>E</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> form of <math alttext="11 T D A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>11</mn><mo>−</mo><mtext>TDA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and females of the <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Z</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> strain produce primarily the <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Z</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> form of <math alttext="11 T D A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>11</mn><mo>−</mo><mtext>TDA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. Males of both strains are more attracted to the form of <math alttext="11 T D A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>11</mn><mo>−</mo><mtext>TDA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> produced by the females of the same strain.
Which of the following best predicts a long-term effect of the differences between the <math alttext="E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>E</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Z</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> strains?

choices.label: The difference between the forms of the sex pheromone <math alttext="11 T D A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>11</mn><mo>−</mo><mtext>TDA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> produced by <math alttext="E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>E</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Z</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> strains will act as a prezygotic reproductive barrier leading to sympatric speciation.

The difference between the forms of the sex pheromone <math alttext="11 T D A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>11</mn><mo>−</mo><mtext>TDA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> produced by <math alttext="E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>E</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Z</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> strains will act as a postzygotic reproductive barrier, leading to allopatric speciation.

Since the <math alttext="E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>E</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Z</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> strains are both part of the same species, they will produce fertile offspring, leading to a single strain that produces both forms of <math alttext="11 T D A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>11</mn><mo>−</mo><mtext>TDA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Since the <math alttext="E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>E</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Z</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> strains are found in the same geographic area, they will hybridize, leading to a single strain that produces the dominant form of <math alttext="11 T D A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>11</mn><mo>−</mo><mtext>TDA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: The difference between the forms of the sex pheromone <math alttext="11 T D A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>11</mn><mo>−</mo><mtext>TDA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> produced by <math alttext="E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>E</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Z</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> strains will act as a prezygotic reproductive barrier leading to sympatric speciation.

skill.text: 6.E: Predict the causes or effects of a change in, or disruption to, one or more components in a biological system.
